analysis.cycleDescription: arguments tend to happen late at night when tired

summary: The speaker discusses arguments with a spouse, noting that disputes often arise late at night after the kids are asleep. These arguments typically occur because both partners are tired, hungry, and overwhelmed, making it difficult to address issues from the day or week. Despite efforts to prevent this pattern, late night remains the most common time for their disagreements.
title: Late-Night Spousal Disputes

summary: The speakers discuss how their arguments have changed since having kids, noting that their most significant disagreements have arisen post-children. They attribute this to being more tired and passionate as parents, making it harder to brush off conflicts easily, unlike before having kids. Despite this increase in disagreements, both seem to prefer avoiding conflict, although one acknowledges enjoying debates, which sometimes lead to conflict.
